intro: Silene falconeriana, commonly known as the Falconer's campion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Silene falconeriana is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
